request.description:
Purpose
Register a new user account in the E-commerce API.

Method and URL
- HTTP Method: POST
- URL: {{base_url}}/auth/register
  - {{base_url}} is an environment/collection variable representing the API base URL.

Required headers
- Content-Type: application/json

Request body
- Body type: raw (JSON)
- Schema (shape):
  {
    "username": "string",
    "email": "string (valid email)",
    "password": "string (meets server password policy)"
  }
- Example:
  {
    "username": "testuser",
    "email": "user@example.com",
    "password": "SecurePass123!"
  }

Successful response example (201)
- Status: 201 Created
- Body:
  {
    "success": true,
    "message": "User registered successfully",
    "data": {
      "id": "88e507c7-4eef-4616-bef3-773695854d67",
      "username": "testuser",
      "email": "user@example.com",
      "role": "user",
      "created_at": "2025-11-12T04:21:25.093Z"
    }
  }

Expected status codes
- 201 Created: User registered successfully.
- 400 Bad Request: Validation failed (e.g., missing fields, invalid email, weak password) or duplicate username/email.
- 409 Conflict: Username or email already exists (if the API distinguishes from 400).
- 500 Internal Server Error: Unexpected server error.

Tests in post-response script
- "Status code is 201": Asserts the response status is 201.
- "Response has success true": Parses JSON and asserts success === true.

Notes
- Ensure the base_url variable is set in the selected environment.
- This request uses a raw JSON body; make sure Content-Type is application/json.
- Save a 201 example after a successful call to streamline future testing/mocking.

- Name: Login User
- Summary: Authenticate a user and return a JWT token for subsequent requests.
- Method & URL: POST {{base_url}}/auth/login
- Description:
  This endpoint authenticates a user using their email and password. On success it returns a JSON object with user details and a JWT token. The request uses the workspace collection variable {{base_url}} for the base URL.
- Request headers:
  - Content-Type: application/json
- Request body (raw JSON):
  {"email": "user@example.com","password": "SecurePass123!"}
  - email: string â€” required, user's registered email address
  - password: string â€” required, user's password
- Successful response (HTTP 200) example:
  {"success": true,"message": "Login successful","data": {"user": { "id": "uuid", "username": "testuser", "email": "user@example.com", "role": "user" },"token": "<jwt token>" }}
- Post-response actions:
  The request has a post-response script that saves the returned token into the collection variable user_token (pm.collectionVariables.set("user_token", jsonData.data.token)). This token can be used in subsequent requests, e.g. set Authorization: Bearer {{user_token}}.
- Tests:
  - Asserts status is 200
  - Asserts response body success is true
- Common errors:
  - 400/422 â€” missing or invalid email/password
  - 401 â€” invalid credentials
- Security note:
  - Do not commit real user passwords or production tokens into saved examples or descriptions. Use placeholder/example values only.
- Example usage:
  - Use this request to authenticate a test user before running protected endpoint requests; after a successful run the collection variable user_token will be populated for use by other requests.

POST /auth/login

Purpose:
Authenticate a user (admin) and return a JWT token and user profile. Use this endpoint to obtain an authentication token for subsequent admin-protected requests.

URL:
{{base_url}}/auth/login

Headers:
- Content-Type: application/json
- Accept: application/json

Request body (application/json):
{
  "email": "string", // required - user email
  "password": "string" // required - user password
}

Example request body:
{
  "email": "admin@ecommerce.com",
  "password": "Admin123!"
}

Successful response (200):
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Login successful",
  "data": {
    "user": {
      "id": "uuid",
      "username": "admin",
      "email": "admin@ecommerce.com",
      "role": "admin"
    },
    "token": "<JWT token>"
  }
}

Errors:
- 400 Bad Request: missing or invalid fields.
- 401 Unauthorized: invalid credentials.
- 500 Internal Server Error: server-side error.

Notes:
- The request has a post-response script that saves the returned token to the collection variable 'admin_token' when the response code is 200. This variable can be used in subsequent admin requests as Authorization: Bearer {{admin_token}}.

Testing tips:
- Use a valid admin account. After a successful login, ensure subsequent admin requests include: Authorization: Bearer {{admin_token}}.

Summary:
Create a new product (Admin only).

Details:
This endpoint lets an admin create a new product in the catalog. The request requires a valid admin Bearer token in the Authorization header and a JSON body describing the product. On success it returns 201 Created and the created product data. The post-response script saves the returned product ID to collection variable {{product_id}} for reuse in later requests (Get/Update/Delete product).

Request
- Method: POST
- URL: {{base_url}}/products
- Headers:
  - Authorization: Bearer {{admin_token}}
  - Content-Type: application/json

Request schema
{
  "name": "string (required)",
  "description": "string",
  "price": "number (required)",
  "stock": "integer",
  "category": "string"
}

Example request body
{
  "name": "Wireless Headphones",
  "description": "Noise-cancelling over-ear headphones",
  "price": 199.99,
  "stock": 25,
  "category": "Electronics"
}

Example 201 response
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Product created successfully",
  "data": {
    "id": "893e8acb-aea2-4c8e-9ac7-b7fc90b676be",
    "name": "New product test",
    "description": "Description of New product",
    "price": 99.99,
    "stock": 50,
    "category": "Electronics",
    "created_at": "2025-11-12T04:22:13.773Z"
  }
}

Notes
- Make sure {{base_url}} and {{admin_token}} are set in your environment before sending.
- The post-response script saves the new product id to collection variable {{product_id}} when response status is 201.
- If you receive 401/403, check that the admin token is valid and has product:create permissions.
- Consider adding tests to assert response code 201 and presence of data.id.

Purpose
Retrieve a paginated list of products available in the store.

HTTP
GET {{base_url}}/products

Query parameters
- page (integer, optional): Page index to fetch. Defaults to 1 if omitted.
- limit (integer, optional): Number of items per page. Defaults to 10 if omitted. Typical range: 1â€“100.

Response shape (200 OK)
{
  "success": boolean,
  "message": string,
  "data": [
    {
      "id": string,            // Product UUID
      "name": string,
      "description": string,
      "price": number,         // e.g., 100.99
      "stock": number,         // available units
      "category": string,      // e.g., "Electronics"
      "created_at": string     // ISO 8601 timestamp
    }
  ],
  "pageNumber": number,        // current page number
  "pageSize": number,          // page size used
  "totalSize": number          // total number of products
}

Example response
{"success":true,"message":"Products retrieved successfully","data":[{"id":"d511a2ff-e3d9-4dda-8b48-dc4da75f5c1f","name":"Television","description":"Description dÃ©taillÃ©e","price":100.99,"stock":8,"category":"Electronics","created_at":"2025-11-11T16:38:44.460Z"},{"id":"7fd664fe-8443-472f-b426-33da5585f09d","name":"Nouveau Produit","description":"Description dÃ©taillÃ©e du nouveau produit","price":99.99,"stock":49,"category":"Electronics","created_at":"2025-11-11T02:32:04.108Z"}],"pageNumber":1,"pageSize":10,"totalSize":2}

Authentication and usage notes
- Auth: If the API supports public catalog browsing, this endpoint may be public. If your deployment requires authentication, inherit Bearer Token auth from the collection or set a token on this request.
- Pagination: Use page and limit to page through results. When page*limit exceeds totalSize, data may be empty.
- Filtering/sorting: Not supported by this request unless implemented server-side; see API docs if available.
- Rate limiting: If enforced by your server, respect Retry-After headers and back off accordingly.
- Environments: base_url is sourced from the active environment.

Summary
Retrieves a single product by its unique ID.

Path variables
- base_url: Base URL of the E-commerce API (e.g., https://api.example.com/v1).
- product_id: UUID or identifier of the product to fetch.

Method and URL
GET {{base_url}}/products/{{product_id}}

Required headers
- Accept: application/json

Example successful response (200)
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Product retrieved successfully",
  "data": {
    "id": "893e8acb-aea2-4c8e-9ac7-b7fc90b676be",
    "name": "New product test",
    "description": "Description of New product",
    "price": 99.99,
    "stock": 50,
    "category": "Electronics",
    "created_at": "2025-11-12T04:22:13.773Z"
  }
}

Status codes
- 200 OK: Product was found and returned.
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid product_id format or missing variables.
- 404 Not Found: No product exists with the given product_id.
- 500 Internal Server Error: Unexpected server error.

Notes on errors
- Ensure product_id is a valid identifier (often a UUID). Incorrect formats typically return 400.
- If the product does not exist, expect 404 with an explanatory message.
- For intermittent server issues, retry with backoff.

Example usage (curl)
curl --request GET \
  --url "{{base_url}}/products/{{product_id}}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json"

Summary: Delete a product by ID

Purpose
- Permanently deletes a product from the catalog by its ID.
- Requires admin authentication.
- Use with caution: deletion is irreversible.

Endpoint
- Method: DELETE
- URL: {{base_url}}/products/{{product_id}}

Path Parameters
- product_id (required): The unique identifier of the product to delete.

Headers
- Authorization (required): Bearer token of an admin user. Example: Bearer {{admin_token}}

Response Examples
- 200 OK
  Body:
  {
    "success": true,
    "message": "Product deleted successfully"
  }

Possible Errors
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid product_id or malformed request.
- 401 Unauthorized: Missing or invalid admin token.
- 404 Not Found: Product with the given ID does not exist.

Usage Notes
- Authentication: Admin role required.
- Ensure {{product_id}} is valid before sending the request.
- Operation is irreversible; consider soft-delete or backups before deletion.

Purpose: Create a new order for the authenticated user.

Method: POST
Endpoint: {{base_url}}/orders

Required headers:
- Authorization: Bearer <jwt> (must be a valid user token)
- Content-Type: application/json

Request body schema:
{
  "items": [
    {
      "productId": "string (UUID)",
      "quantity": integer (>=1)
    }
  ]
}

Example request body:
{
  "items": [
    {
      "productId": "d511a2ff-e3d9-4dda-8b48-dc4da75f5c1f",
      "quantity": 2
    }
  ]
}

Possible responses:
- 201 Created (success):
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Order created successfully",
  "data": {
    "id": "e8e0d0b8-56c0-4cd0-9820-95db44a6ead1",
    "user_id": "88e507c7-4eef-4616-bef3-773695854d67",
    "description": "Order with 1 item(s)",
    "total_price": 201.98,
    "status": "pending",
    "items": [ /* array of order items with product_id, product_name, quantity, unit_price, total_price */ ],
    "created_at": "2025-11-12T04:25:38.582Z"
  }
}
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid body (e.g., missing items, invalid quantity)
- 401 Unauthorized: Missing/invalid token
- 404 Not Found: productId does not exist

Post-response script:
On status 201, saves collection variable order_id from response body data.id.

Notes:
- Ensure the Bearer token belongs to an active user.
- quantity must be >= 1.
- productId must correspond to an existing product.

Endpoint: Get User Orders

Summary
Retrieve the authenticated userâ€™s paginated list of orders, including order items and totals.

Request
- Method: GET
- URL: {{base_url}}/orders?page={{page}}&limit={{limit}}
  â€¢ Default in this request: page=1, limit=10

Required Headers
- Authorization: Bearer {{user_token}}

Successful Response (200)
Example body:
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Orders retrieved successfully",
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "e8e0d0b8-56c0-4cd0-9820-95db44a6ead1",
      "user_id": "88e507c7-4eef-4616-bef3-773695854d67",
      "description": "Order with 1 item(s)",
      "total_price": 201.98,
      "status": "pending",
      "items": [
        {
          "product_id": "d511a2ff-e3d9-4dda-8b48-dc4da75f5c1f",
          "product_name": "Television",
          "quantity": 2,
          "unit_price": 100.99,
          "total_price": 201.98
        }
      ],
      "created_at": "2025-11-12T04:25:38.582Z"
    }
  ],
  "pageNumber": 1,
  "pageSize": 10,
  "totalSize": 1
}

Usage Notes
- Ensure {{user_token}} is from a logged-in user; admin tokens may return a different scope depending on API rules.
- Use page and limit to paginate through results. Large limits may be capped by the server.
- No request body is required. Consider adding tests to assert success === true and that data is an array.
- Common errors: 401 Unauthorized (missing/expired token).

Title: Get Order by ID

Description:
Retrieves a single order by its ID. Use this endpoint to fetch order details including items, prices, status, and timestamps.

URL and variables:
- base_url (environment variable): Base URL for the API (e.g., https://api.example.com).
- order_id (path variable): UUID of the order to retrieve. Example: e8e0d0b8-56c0-4cd0-9820-95db44a6ead1.

Headers:
- Authorization: Bearer {{user_token}} (required) â€” A valid JWT or bearer token representing the authenticated user.
- Accept: application/json (recommended)

Success Response (200):
- success: true
- message: Order retrieved successfully
- data: object containing order details (id, user_id, description, total_price, status, items, created_at).

Example of data fields:
- id: order UUID
- user_id: UUID of the user who placed the order
- description: short description of the order
- total_price: numeric total amount
- status: string (e.g., pending, paid, shipped)
- items: array of item objects (product_id, product_name, quantity, unit_price, total_price)
- created_at: ISO 8601 timestamp

Errors:
- 401 Unauthorized: missing/invalid token
- 404 Not Found: order not found
- 400 Bad Request: invalid order_id format

Suggested tests (Postman tests to add):
1) Verify status is 200 and response.success is true.
2) Verify response.data.id equals the requested {{order_id}}.
3) Verify response.data.items is an array and each item contains product_id, product_name, quantity, unit_price, total_price.
4) Verify total_price equals the sum of item total_price values.

Notes:
- Ensure {{user_token}} belongs to a user authorized to view the order.
- Use the Get User Orders endpoint to list orders and obtain a valid order_id for testing.

Summary: Health check endpoint to verify the E-commerce API service is up and responsive.

Method & URL:
- GET http://localhost:8000/health

Expected Successful Response:
- Status: 200 OK
- Body (JSON example):
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "ðŸš€ E-commerce API is running!",
  "timestamp": "<ISO-8601 datetime>",
  "version": "1.0.0"
}

Common Use Cases:
- Readiness/liveness probes for container orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
- CI/CD smoke tests to confirm the service is reachable after deployment.
- Local development sanity checks to ensure the server started correctly.
- Uptime and monitoring pings.

Troubleshooting Tips:
- If the request fails to connect, ensure the server is running and listening on port 8000 (check APP_PORT or server logs).
- If you receive a non-200 status:
  - 500: Check server logs for startup errors or dependency issues.
  - 404: Confirm the route is /health and no base path prefix is required.
- If running behind a proxy/reverse proxy, verify the correct host/port mapping and that HTTP is used (or update to HTTPS if applicable).
- For local testing conflicts, ensure no other process is using port 8000.
- If the response JSON differs, verify the application version/environment; some deployments may customize the message or version fields.
